intro: Villaria acutifolia, commonly known as the sharpleaf villaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, clustered in inflorescences at the leaf axils. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
